'''Xatu''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ネイティオ''' ''Natio'') is a dual-type {{2t|Psychic|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Natu}} starting at [[level]] 25.

==Biology==
Xatu is a green {{wp|condor}}-like Pokémon with long, red-and-black tipped white wings that cover most of its front. Underneath its wings are designs that resemble red eyes. Along with its main green coloration, Xatu's design has accents of black, yellow, and red. There is an extra set of yellow stripes on a male Xatu. It has almond eyes, a long, slightly hooked beak, and two long, red feather crests. Xatu's feet have only two toes, one in front and one in back. Xatu's design is similar to a {{wp|totem pole}} or a {{wp|kachina doll}}.

Xatu tends to stand still all day. One theory explains that Xatu can see into the future with its right eye and the past with its left, and it does not move due to fears of its visions of the future coming true. [[EP234|The anime]] has shown that it can communicate its by moving its wings in a {{wp|flag semaphore|semaphore}} fashion. Xatu is believed to be native to {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|the forests}} of {{wp|South America}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Clown Xatu.png|thumb|left|220px|Xatu in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Xatu debuted in ''[[EP234|Xatu the Future]]'', under the ownership of {{OBP|Calista|EP234}}, a girl who could predict the future.

A Xatu was seen in ''[[AG076|Me, Myself and Time]]'', under the ownership of another girl named {{OBP|Calista|AG076}}, who traveled back in time to give her younger self a message.

A Xatu appeared in ''[[DP140|Historical Mystery Tour!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Clown}}.

===Minor appearances===
Xatu was seen starring in an outer-space version of the movie "{{wp|Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic}}" in ''[[AG086|Lights, Camerupt, Action!]]''.

A Xatu, along with three Natu, was used to signal the start of a Water Pokémon race in ''[[M05|Pokémon Heroes: Latios & Latias]]''.

A Xatu made a very brief appearance in the opening sequences of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]'' and ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Crystal Natee.png|thumb|175px|Xatu in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS173|The Escape]]'', [[Will]] uses a Xatu to fight {{adv|Blue}} and {{adv|Silver}}, but loses to a powerful {{m|Return}} attack.

Two Xatu appeared in ''[[PS159|Popular Pupitar]]''. A Xatu appeared in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' as one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

A Xatu appeared in ''[[PS327|Facing Gulpin Is Hard to Swallow]]'' as a rental Pokémon that [[Guile Hideout]] stole.

Prior to ''[[PS319|Verily Vanquishing Vileplume I]]'', {{adv|Crystal}}'s {{p|Natu}} had evolved into a Xatu, and with his augmented strength allowed faster flight for her.

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
{{GnB|Black}} owns a Xatu in [[Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys|The Golden Boys]] manga.

===In the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Ginji's Rescue Team manga===
{{OBP|Xatu|Red and Blue Rescue Team}} appeared in ''[[GRT2|I Want to be Human Again!]]'' where it told [[Ginji]] and {{OBP|Mudkip|Ginji's Rescue Team}} about Ginji's future. It then appeared in ''[[GRT6|Tears and Emotions - It's the Final Chapter!]]'' where it, along with several other Pokémon, helped defeat {{p|Groudon}}.

==In the TFG==
One Xatu figure has been released.
* {{TFG|Groundbreakers}}: {{TFG ID|Groundbreakers|Xatu|37}}

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon]]: {{mdc|Xatu|1}} lives on the [[Hill of the Ancients]], located beyond the [[Great Canyon]]. Xatu is well regarded as a wise Pokémon with the ability to see into the future. The player first consults Xatu in an attempt to learn why they were turned into a Pokémon. Later on, he creates the [[Teleport Gem]] to teleport the player to the [[Sky Tower]]. After getting the [[Clear Wing]] from {{p|Spinda}}, Xatu reveals that the player must first go to the three fields and face the lord of the areas (the [[Legendary beasts]]). Xatu occasionally visits [[Pokémon Square]] for shopping and gave [[Meteor Cave]] its name on one of these trips.
* {{g|Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness}}: Xatu runs a shop in [[Treasure Town]] called Xatu's Appraisal. He unlocks any [[treasure box]]es found in dungeons for 150 [[Poké]] per box.

==Trivia==
* Xatu shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Flygon}}. They are both known as the Mystic Pokémon in English, and the Spirit Pokémon in Japanese.
* Xatu's Silver, FireRed, and SoulSilver Pokédex entries state that it is involved in South American myths, which is a connection between the Pokémon world and [[Pokémon world in relation to the real world|the real world]].

===Origin===
It seems to be based on a {{wp|Resplendent Quetzal}} with design elements from a {{wp|Native American}} {{wp|totem}} or {{wp|kachina}}. Behaviorwise, it displays the ancient art of Sun Gazing, a form of spiritual meditation practiced by the Aztec and Mayan peoples in the belief that it would give them supernatural power; this is referenced by the fact that Xatu is part {{t|Psychic}}.

====Name origin====
As revealed in a Penny Arcade Staff Podcast by Jeff Kalles, who assisted in the naming of many [[Generation II]] Pokémon, a Xat is a sort of Native American totem pole. Xatu's name arose from The Pokémon Company's desire to have one Pokémon for every letter of the alphabet.

Natio may be a corruption of ''native''.
